news.title: John Torode sacked as MasterChef host after racist language allegation upheld
news.summary: With the show in crisis, BBC director general Tim Davie said no decision has been made on the next series.

news.title: Thousands of Afghans were moved to UK in secret scheme after data breach
news.summary: The existence of the scheme could not be reported until now because of a court injunction.

news.title: Men who felled Sycamore Gap tree in act of 'sheer bravado' jailed
news.summary: One of the men's lawyers says felling the Sycamore Gap tree was an act of "drunken stupidity".

news.title: I'm 'disappointed but not done' with Putin, Trump tells BBC
news.summary: Trump says he trusts "almost nobody" in exclusive interview discussing the war in Ukraine, Nato and the UK.

news.title: Trump woke me up for a surprise interview - these are the key takeaways
news.summary: The US president signalled a new tone on Nato, voiced his respect for Keir Starmer - and showed his reflective side.

news.title: Constance Marten spent months at 'torture' church, friend tells BBC
news.summary: Aged 19, Marten became a disciple of a notorious preacher who allegedly controlled and raped women.

news.title: Severance and The Penguin lead Emmy TV awards nominations
news.summary: See which shows and actors are up for the TV industry's most prestigious awards in Los Angeles.

news.title: Savers to be targeted with offers to invest in shares under new plans
news.summary: Banks will send savers details of possible investments and an ad campaign will raise awareness, the Treasury says.

news.title: The undersea tunnel network that could transform Shetland's fortunes
news.summary: The local council says it is pushing ahead with plans to build tunnels to four outlying isles in the archipelago.

news.title: Immigration status of benefit claimants published for first time
news.summary: In June, nearly eight million received universal credit, 83.6% of whom were British and Irish nationals.
